page.title: 04LOCAL HISTORY. HERMIT PUB.
page.content: { The Hermit}is approximately{300 years {old.}It was probably a farmhouse or Inn, but has been a pub most of its life. There used to be a stable in the lower part of the building in which it could keep 4-5 ponies before going to {Leeds or Bradford.}It has three bedrooms, though this was probably one large room in the past.{The Hermit } used to be called {The Woolpack } probably because they would store wool on occasions. There are two rooms on the ground floor which are both tap rooms because barrels are kept there for dispensing ale, some people may call it a still room as the barrels were propped on stills. This room lead out onto a pack horse road which is still there and is called{Prospect {Row.}The building hasn't changed very much.{Mr. Hewitt}rents the pub, and has done for{23yrs}from{John Smiths.
